isis.stitle: Electrical System Troubleshooting Guide - BE 200, CE 200, CE 300 Model - BODY FEATURES - Windshield Wipers And Washer Pump - WASHER CIRCUITS

svcsubproc.title: Fault Detection Management

note.para: The testing method for troubleshooting the electrical systems portrayed in this manual is a basic voltage test. An alternative method of checking for voltage drops within a given circuit may be a quicker method of identifying an exact problem.

svcsubproc.para: A Fault in the washer system will be apparent when the washers do not operate correctly. There are no diagnostic trouble codes associated with the washer circuits.
A problem with washer operation could be attributed to an open or short in the washer switch, missing power to the washer pump motor, open or shorted wires or a failed washer pump motor.

entry.para: Check with ignition on and pump connector (4021) removed.

note.para: Always check connectors for damage and pushed-out terminals.

entry.para: Pump harness connector (4500) cavity B to ground.
If voltage is missing, check for blown fuse or open or short in circuits N87A, K87A, and A87A to fuse block.
With washer switch activated, pump harness connector (4500) cavity B to cavity A.
Tests circuit between ESC and pump motor.
If voltage is missing, check for open or short in circuit N87-G, K87-G, A87-G, A87-GC, and A87-GA
Also perform a continuity test on turn signal switch (1810) between pins 12 and 6. Replace turn signal switch (1810) if it fails the continuity test.
If no opens or shorts are found and the turn signal switch (1810) passes the resistance test, replace the washer pump.

svcsubproc.title: Extended Description
svcsubproc.para: The washer pump motor is wired directly to the washer switch, in the turn signal switch assembly. 12 volts to the washer pump motor is provided from a 10 amp fuse in the fuse block (1011). When the washer switch is depressed, a ground will be supplied to the washer pump motor. This will cause the pump to run until the washer switch is released. The ground from the washer switch is also applied to ESC connector (1600) terminal 28. This will signal the ESC that the washer has been activated. The ESC will activate the low speed wipers for several wipes.
